class_notes:
Pre-requisite: ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 OR permission of instructor
Course description: Interdisciplinary approach to the interaction of human activities with hydrologic systems. Topics include surface and groundwater hydrology, stream dynamics and erosion, municipal and agricultural water development, water quality, and integrated watershed management. Special emphasis will be given to sustainable practices in water resource management to resolve emerging water use challenges. 
Fulfills a general upper level elective, EAS upper level track elective, Earth & Atmospheric Sci for ENVSMIN and Nat'l Science for SUSTSCI minor.
course_description: Variable topics that are offered as irregular courses. Past course topics have included: Finding Place: Technology, Stories, and the Environment; Introduction to Botany; Environment, Health, and Development; Conservation and Development; Booms and Busts in Resources of Georgia; and Paleoecology.
